analyses.title: Transaction and Sales Analysis
analyses.context: Analyzing the sales data to understand overall transaction dynamics and sales patterns in the cafe.

sub_analyses.title: Total Number of Transactions
sub_analyses.why: To understand the total volume of transactions occurring in the cafe.
code_lines: # Counting the total number of unique transactions
result = pd.DataFrame({'TotalTransactions': [dirty_cafe_sales['Transaction ID'].nunique()]})
visualization_code: # Creating a simple bar chart to represent the total number of transactions
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart effectively displays the total number as it is a singular item that needs straightforward representation.

sub_analyses.title: Total Revenue Generated
sub_analyses.why: To determine the total revenue generated from sales.
code_lines: # Converting 'Total Spent' to numeric to avoid type errors and summing to get the total revenue generated
result = pd.DataFrame({'TotalRevenue': [pd.to_numeric(dirty_cafe_sales['Total Spent'], errors='coerce').sum()]})
visualization_code: # Creating a simple bar chart to represent the total revenue generated
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart is used to present the total revenue value cleanly and allows for quick visual assessment of total amounts.

sub_analyses.title: Average Revenue Per Transaction
sub_analyses.why: To gauge the average revenue earned from each transaction in the cafe.
code_lines: # Calculating average revenue per transaction with corrected types for division
total_revenue = pd.to_numeric(dirty_cafe_sales['Total Spent'], errors='coerce').sum()
total_transactions = dirty_cafe_sales['Transaction ID'].nunique()
average_revenue = total_revenue / total_transactions if total_transactions else 0
result = pd.DataFrame({'AverageRevenue': [average_revenue]})
visualization_code: # Creating a simple bar chart to represent average revenue per transaction
sub_analyses.justification: The average amount is best represented as a single bar in a chart, emphasizing its singularity and importance.

sub_analyses.title: Transaction Frequency and Trends
sub_analyses.why: To examine transaction frequencies over time and identify any seasonal or temporal trends.
answers: Transaction count per day or period.
code_lines: # Converting 'Transaction Date' to datetime and counting transactions per date
dirty_cafe_sales['Transaction Date'] = pd.to_datetime(dirty_cafe_sales['Transaction Date'], errors='coerce')
result = dirty_cafe_sales.groupby(dirty_cafe_sales['Transaction Date'].dt.to_period('D')).size().reset_index(name='Transaction Count')
visualization_code: # Creating a line plot to show transaction frequency over time
plt.plot(result['Transaction Date'].astype(str), result['Transaction Count'], marker='o', linestyle='-', color='darkblue')
sub_analyses.justification: A line plot effectively represents data trends over time, visualizing transaction counts to identify temporal patterns.

analyses.title: Item-Specific Sales Analysis
analyses.context: Investigating sales data at an item level to identify popular products and revenue contributions.

sub_analyses.title: Top Selling Items
sub_analyses.why: To identify which items are sold the most in the cafe.
answers: List of items with highest sales volumes.
code_lines: # Grouping by 'Item' to sum quantities and determining top-selling ones
result = dirty_cafe_sales.groupby('Item')['Quantity'].sum().reset_index(name='Total Quantity Sold').sort_values(by='Total Quantity Sold', ascending=False)
visualization_code: # Creating a bar chart for top selling items by quantity
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart provides clear visibility of the quantities sold per item, making it easy to identify top sellers.

sub_analyses.title: Revenue Contribution by Item
sub_analyses.why: To understand which items contribute most to the overall revenue.
code_lines: # Grouping by 'Item' to sum the total spent, indicating revenue per item
result = dirty_cafe_sales.groupby('Item')['Total Spent'].sum().reset_index(name='Total Revenue').sort_values(by='Total Revenue', ascending=False)
visualization_code: # Creating a bar chart to display revenue contribution per item
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart clearly shows revenue distribution across items and highlights the key contributors to total revenue.

sub_analyses.title: Average Price Per Item Sold
sub_analyses.why: To determine the average selling price of items in the cafe.
code_lines: # Calculating the average price per item sold using appropriate type conversion
result = dirty_cafe_sales.groupby('Item')['Price Per Unit'].apply(lambda x: pd.to_numeric(x, errors='coerce').mean()).reset_index(name='Average Price')
visualization_code: # Creating a bar chart for average selling price per item
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart effectively presents average prices per item, facilitating comparisons across different products.

analyses.title: Payment Method Analysis
analyses.context: Analyzing the use of different payment methods across transactions.

sub_analyses.title: Preferred Payment Methods
sub_analyses.why: To determine the most frequently used payment methods in the cafe.
answers: Distribution of different payment methods used.
code_lines: # Counting occurrences of each payment method
result = dirty_cafe_sales['Payment Method'].value_counts().reset_index(name='Usage Count').rename(columns={'index': 'Payment Method'})
visualization_code: # Creating a pie chart for payment method usage distribution
plt.pie(result['Usage Count'], labels=result['Payment Method'], autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90, colors=plt.cm.Paired.colors, wedgeprops={'edgecolor': 'black'})
sub_analyses.justification: A pie chart visually shows the proportion each payment method contributes to the total, highlighting preferences effectively.

sub_analyses.title: Payment Method Impact on Sales
sub_analyses.why: To understand how different payment methods affect total sales.
code_lines: # Summing Total Spent for each Payment Method to assess their impact on sales
result = dirty_cafe_sales.groupby('Payment Method')['Total Spent'].sum().reset_index(name='Total Sales')
visualization_code: # Adjusting the figure size for accurate display
# Creating a bar chart for sales impact per payment method
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart is used to represent how each payment method contributes to total sales in a distinct and visually accessible way.

analyses.title: Location-Based Sales Analysis
analyses.context: Evaluating sales performance across different cafe locations.

sub_analyses.title: Sales by Location
sub_analyses.why: To identify which locations generate the most sales.
code_lines: # Summing Total Spent per Location to find total sales by location
result = dirty_cafe_sales.groupby('Location')['Total Spent'].sum().reset_index(name='Total Sales').sort_values(by='Total Sales', ascending=False)
visualization_code: # Creating a bar chart for sales by location
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart efficiently presents the sales data by location, making it easy to compare and identify leading locations for sales.

sub_analyses.title: Average Spending per Location
sub_analyses.why: To compare customer spending habits at different locations.
answers: Average amount spent per transaction by location.
code_lines: # Calculating average spending per transaction for each location using appropriate type conversion
result = dirty_cafe_sales.groupby('Location')['Total Spent'].apply(lambda x: pd.to_numeric(x, errors='coerce').mean()).reset_index(name='Average Spending')
visualization_code: # Creating a bar chart for average spending per transaction by location
sub_analyses.justification: A bar chart offers a visual comparison of average spending per location, highlighting variations in consumer behavior across sites.
